<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 908, 320]]<|/det|>
October/November 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z| \leqslant 3\), \(\operatorname {Re}z \geqslant - 2\) and \(\frac{1}{4}\pi \leqslant \arg z \leqslant \pi\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 895, 107]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2^{3x - 1} = 5(3^{-x})\). Give your answer in the form \(\frac{\ln a}{\ln b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 118]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 589, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\tan (x + 45^{\circ}) = 2\cot x\) for \(0^{\circ}< x< 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = \frac{x}{\cos^2 x}\), for \(0 \leqslant x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\). At the point where \(x = a\), the tangent to the curve has gradient equal to 12.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 123, 490, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that \(a = \cos^{- 1}\left(\sqrt[3]{\frac{\cos a + 2a \sin a}{12}}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 140, 920, 159]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 562, 92]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that \(a\) lies between 0.9 and 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part (a) to determine \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
In a certain chemical reaction the amount, \(x\) grams, of a substance is increasing. The differential equation satisfied by \(x\) and \(t\), the time in seconds since the reaction began, is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 114, 556, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = kx\mathrm{e}^{-0.1t},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 152, 747, 170]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a positive constant. It is given that \(x = 20\) at the start of the reaction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 183, 146, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 183, 719, 201]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\), \(t\) and \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 88, 777, 275]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 298, 824, 320]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = (3 - x)\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{3}x}\) for \(x\geqslant 0\), and its minimum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 330, 146, 349]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 330, 420, 349]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 330, 918, 349]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region bounded by the curve and the axes, giving your answer in terms of e.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 84, 771, 336]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 361, 920, 428]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OABCD\) is a solid figure in which \(OA = OB = 4\) units and \(OD = 3\) units. The edge \(OD\) is vertical, \(DC\) is parallel to \(OB\) and \(DC = 1\) unit. The base, \(OAB\), is horizontal and angle \(AOB = 90^\circ\). Unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\) are parallel to \(OA\), \(OB\) and \(OD\) respectively. The midpoint of \(AB\) is \(M\) and the point \(N\) on \(BC\) is such that \(CN = 2NB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 443, 146, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 440, 564, 462]]<|/det|>
Express vectors \(\overrightarrow{MD}\) and \(\overrightarrow{ON}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 443, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 715, 92]]<|/det|>
Calculate the angle in degrees between the directions of \(\overrightarrow{MD}\) and \(\overrightarrow{ON}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 485, 186, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 483, 670, 504]]<|/det|>
Show that the length of the perpendicular from \(M\) to \(ON\) is \(\sqrt{\frac{22}{5}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 486, 920, 504]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
